prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: In reading articles online I look for things that will interest me. The first thing that comes to mind is health related information. I like to read about different food and drink that may be beneficial or harmful to me. That's something I like to keep on top of and always catches my eye. Also I like to read articles about mens grooming. Even though I look like I probably don't spend much time taking care of myself, I do care about my skin and I am constantly on the lookout for articles about different products or different things I can do to improve my skin. Other articles I like to read are recommendations for things to watch on streaming services. It's always entertaining to read those and I like to keep up with what the newest releases are. When it comes to news, I tend to read articles that are sort of true crime based. The sorts of articles that have to do with murder or abductions. It seems kind of creepy when I type that out, but I do enjoy reading those sorts of articles. Sometimes I will read articles about current politics. I might read something that talks about Trump or Biden. But for the most part, for politics, I just read the headlines. I sometimes read articles on business and technology matters. I like to keep up with some of the business related news and technology like new phones.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I'm interested in global warming and the environment and things being done related to that

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: The Atlantic
Title: What Does Sentience Really Mean?
Description: The fact that AI isn’t alive doesn’t mean it can’t be sentient, the sociologist Jacy Reese Anthis argues.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I'm interested in finding out more about AI. It's suddenly everywhere and I don't really understand it all

evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.explanation: I'm getting older and interesting in anything that will help me keep my brain working well
